attributes.action: Petition the Government to stop expanding the badger cull across the country
attributes.background: Bovine TB is a devastating disease for farmers and cattle. However, the badger cull is proven to be unscientific Inhumane and ineffective.At a cost of £20 million pounds so far a roll out across the country can not be justified.Move away from culling and focus on cattle based measures.
attributes.additional_details:
Wales have reduced incidents of bovine TB by 48% without killing a single badger.

The Randomised badger culling trials undertaken by the last government killed 11,000 badgers and proved that culling badgers will not reduce the disease

95% of the disease is spread by cattle

attributes.action: Hold A Referendum On Renationalisation Of The Railways
attributes.background: According to YouGov Polls, 66% of the UK Electorate now support renationalisation of the UK railways. It is clear that privatisation of the railway system has caused massive operation inefficiencies due to the complexity of the railway network.

attributes.action: Stop the deportation of Luqman Onikosi!
attributes.background: In 2007 Luqman Onikosi came to the UK from Nigeria to study. Whilst in the UK he developed chronic liver disease. The Home Office wants to deport him to Nigeria, which does not have the medical facilities to support him. If he is deported in all likelihood he will die.
attributes.additional_details:
https://ceasefiremagazine.co.uk/humiliation-end-stop-deporting-people-deaths/
http://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2013/jan/25/why-luqman-onikosi-remain-britain

attributes.action: Protect grouse Moors and grouse shooting
attributes.background: Grouse moors and grouse shooting are an integral part of moorland management both for the grouse and other native wildlife such as lapwing and curlew it also helps support of local businesses and jobs in the local areas this cannot be banned
attributes.additional_details:
Here is a link to the Countryside Alliance website for more information on how grouse moors benefit the environment and the facts behind it:

http://www.countryside-alliance.org/ca-flatcap/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/Grouse-Shooting-The-Facts-10-Key-Questions-Answered-July-2016.pdf

attributes.action: SEN budgets need to be ring fenced for children's education not LA legal fees.
attributes.background:
Mr. Ed Timpson claimed that "No child should lose their support simply because the system is changing". Conversely parents find that Local Authorities regularly remove vital support in the transfer to the new EHC Plans.
Severe budget cuts to Education mean that parents face an adversarial system.
attributes.additional_details:
Children with SEN are routinely denied appropriate education and LA's adopt a defensive stance. Cash is diverted to legal fees to defend against appeals. Parents report huge personal and financial losses in attempts to gain SEN provision.
Recently, a law firm which represents and ‘trains’ LA''s have publicly gloated about their 'WINs' against parents. Local Autho have attempted to distance themselves from this scandal; however parents nationally have reported equally negative experiences.

attributes.action: See fibromyalgia has a disability and give the pip payment
attributes.background: I suffer from fibromyalgia and have to really suffer because I was turned down for the pip payment because of the point system, I have to cut my working hours, I may have to end work because of the pain I now suffer
attributes.additional_details: Doctors letters and reports, medication I'm on

attributes.action: DENY the request for a second EU REFERENDUM
attributes.background: The British public have decided that they no longer want to be part of the EU. The minority within the Leave campaign believe there should be a second referendum. This is neither fair nor democratic. The majority have decided. The remain voters need to accept they have lost and move forward.

attributes.action: Allow motorcycles to use ALL bus lanes.
attributes.background:
Bikes take up less space than most other road users and therefore aren't seen as readily and are at greater risk of personal injury. 

We are legally allowed to filter past the queuing traffic and get to the front, this way would help make it even safer without affecting the buses and taxis.

attributes.action: Make discrimination against Armed Forces personnel and veterans an offence
attributes.background: I am, and always have been, very proud of the fact that I am an RAF Veteran. Recently though, when I tried to make a purchase from a retailer, I was told that the owner didn't work with "Murderers and Terrorists" He had seen a picture of me in uniform, and so decided I was, in effect, a terrorist.
attributes.additional_details:
My experience is just one of many incidents in which Forces personnel are singled out and discriminated against. The Police can do nothing about it because the Armed Forces aren't recognised as a group in law. 

With events in the past, such as the killing of Lee Rigby, it has become apparent that anyone with a Forces background is a potential target for hate crimes and discrimination. A change in the law will give the police the power to investigate and prevent further serious incidents.

attributes.action: Abandon DfE plans to make Year 7 children resit SATs in Mathematics and English
attributes.background: Children in Year 6 at Primary School currently sit National Tests ("SATs") in Mathematics and English. The DfE are proposing that children who fail to reach a "required standard" will resit these tests at Secondary School in Year 7.
attributes.additional_details:
Guidance for schools on this, which was previously available on the DfE website, was recently removed (something which the DfE, despite evidence to the contrary, later denied).

Mathematics teaching professionals believe that there will not be enough time to effectively implement these changes for a September 2017 start. Moreover, we believe that their implementation will slow the Secondary curriculum, create a testing culture, and reinforce a language of failure inappropriate at such a young age.

attributes.action: Legalise car cruising or give us designated areas to meet
attributes.background: Police have been clamping down on car cruising. Car cruising is not a crime but for some people is a way of life.People withing the car scene modify their cars and want people to see their work they have done. Each car is diffrent and we want a chance to show people our work.
attributes.additional_details: In the car scene when a meet is organised we try to meet in an area that cant effect the public. We do not intend to cause any harm to the public we just want to meet and make new friends and show our builds. With atleast giving us a designated area to meet we will be able to meet new people with common interests and show our builds without causing harm or distress to the public.

attributes.action: Ensure the survival & funding of our high quality maintained nursery schools.
attributes.background: Only 408 maintained nursery schools are left in England. 200 have been closed since1995. These extremely successful (97% are good or outstanding) inclusive places for children under 5 & their families are schools, but are not funded as schools, & thus are under huge threat of being lost forever.
attributes.additional_details:
Maintained nursery schools support higher than average concentrations of children with SEND & have the expertise & skills to support them successfully. They are extremely successful at closing the gap between the most disadvantaged children and their peers. They are led by specialist headteachers & employ qualified teachers & nursery nurses. 64% are in the 30% most deprived areas in England. 
See the Early Education report: 'Maintained Nursery Schools: the state of play' March 2015 for more info

attributes.action: Stop the travel companies charging high prices for school holiday weeks.
attributes.background: Everyone is complaining about being fined for taking our children out of school to go on holiday. The travel companies are at fault as I believe the majority of people would take their children away during school holidays if they could afford it.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to prohibit the wearing of an earned Armed Forces Veteran Badge.
attributes.background: A bus company has prohibited wearing of Veterans badges on the grounds of Uniformity yet encourages wearing Trade Union badges. This is contrary to the spirit of the Military Covenant. The badge is recognition of service to the nation & denying the right to wear it disrespects that veterans service.

attributes.action: Change to abortion laws in NI by amended the devolved powers the NI assembly has
attributes.background: This week a young women was sentenced to 2 years suspended for being to poor to travel out of Northern Ireland for an abortion, it is time the UK government acted to force equal treatment
attributes.additional_details: Northern Ireland's abortion laws still put women's lives at risk and discriminate against those to poor to travel to the rest of the UK, This is done with the support of the UK government and using tax payments from the rest of the UK as such the UK government should amend Northern Ireland's devolved powers or use alternative legislation to force the Northern Irish assembly to treat women and their right to an abortion equally to the rest of the UK

attributes.action: Introduce plastic alcohol glasses in clubs and bars after 12am
attributes.background: I was glassed in a unprovoked attack while on a night out. I am asking clubs and bars to introduce plastic to reduce the chance of serious injury to other members of the public. I was left with my face scarred for life, which affected my career, mental health, family and my 3 beautiful children.
attributes.additional_details:
Please read links below for CCTV of the horrendous attack and sign to stop this happening to anyone else. 

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3589464/Clubber-37-scarred-model-life-unprovoked-bar-attack-smashing-wine-glass-face-leaving-needing-50-stitches.html

http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/news/liverpool-news/watch-moment-model-scarred-life-11331136

attributes.action: Prevent the sale of the Royal Bank of Scotland at a loss to the taxpayer
attributes.background: According to analysis of figures published by the Government on Wednesday (16th March) by Sky News, the Government are potentially planning on selling their shares in RBS at a massive £20bn loss to the taxpayer. But we don't have to accept this loss because they don't have to sell.
attributes.additional_details:
Sky News: http://news.sky.com/story/1661144/taxpayers-face-20bn-loss-on-rbs-share-sales
Move Your Money: http://moveyourmoney.org.uk/budget-2016/

attributes.action: The people of scotland demand a second independence referendum
attributes.background: With continued lies and deceit from westminster, we the people of scotland demand a second independence referendum without objection from westminster

attributes.action: A full review of the staffing shortages within NHS district nursing service.
attributes.background: People prefer to recover at home. The district nursing service, with the reductions in staffing since 2003 is at breaking point. District nurses are now critically endangered health professionals says the royal college of nursing and 10,000 front line staff are required.
attributes.additional_details:
There has been large cuts to the district nursing service, senior nursing sisters who require the specialist practitioner degree have been reduced in numbers and in high demand with many jobs advertised for months waiting to be filled.
District nurses will dissappear by 2025.
Only 37% of time spent dealing with patients. 
2003 - 2013 47% drop in staff from 12,620 to 6,656. Ref: Royal College of Nursing.
We want the government to debate this and commit to recruiting front line staff required.

attributes.action: Hold a second referendum on leaving the EU once exit terms have been negotiated.
attributes.background: On 23rd June 2016, the UK voted to leave the EU. The terms of the departure have yet to be agreed with the EU, and the possibilities vary widely on key issues such as access to the single market and limiting immigration. Once terms are agreed, a second vote should be held to confirm the decision.
attributes.additional_details:
During campaigning ahead of the EU referendum, many parties, including politicians and supporters on both sides of the debate, noted that the structure of any agreement to leave was uncertain. The terms that the UK would negotiate with the EU were subject to claim and counter-claim on both sides.

The public, therefore, were not aware of the full nature of the 'leave' outcome at that time and should be given the opportunity to vote on again once an agreement with the EU is reached.

attributes.action: Give parents rights to be involved with their disabled adult childs decisions.
attributes.background: The capacity criteria is too low for most invisibly vulnerable disabled adults of 18 with foetal alcohol spectrum disorder, autism etc, their brain damage, impulsivity &  dysmaturity can be dangerous &  families are excluded from legally keeping their adult child safe from themselves & others.
attributes.additional_details:
Give parents of invisibly disabled children with special needs of 18 + legal rights to assist them in making decisions that affect theirs and their families lives post 18. Even with care plans & EHCPS in place they have no legal rights .
Young people with FASD,  autism etc are being failed by law and the system as the capacity threshold  is too low & is not checking for neurodevelopmental disorders  in the same way that IQ tests do not check for capacity, vulnerability or gullibility! Adults with FASD are failed by services that should offer protection and support for our vulnerable children and adults. Parents are being denied rights to protect their child as law dispels their rights to be involved in their vulnerable child's decisions should the young person wish.

attributes.action: Stop the boundary changes
attributes.background: The Goverment are about to introduce political boundary changes, which could see the Tory party in power indefinately, with very little possible opposition. This is a cynical attempt at power grabbing, and an affront to democracy, which must not go ahead.
attributes.additional_details: These boundary changes will see the Labour Prty lose 10% of their seats, the Lib dems 50%, but the Tories a mere 4%. If the 2015 election had been fought on these changes, the Tory majority would have trippled from 11 to 33 seats.

attributes.action: Increase NHS Pay in Accordance with the Living Wage Increases
attributes.background: I propose for the NHS pay to me increased in line with the increase from National Minimum Wage to the new Living Wage.  A 1% pay increase has been proposed for NHS employees as of April 2016, at the same time the new Living Wage will come in to play.  The increase from NMW to Living Wage is 7.46%.
attributes.additional_details:
I work for NHS on the Band 3 Agenda for Change payscale.  At present I earn £17495 per annum.  The 1% pay rise results in a new salary of £17669 > a gross increase of £15.33pm, subject to income tax and NI deductions.  
The increase from NMW to Living Wage = 7.46% increase.  Therefore there is only a £1.83/hr difference between me and someone on Living Wage, where before there was a £2.24/hr difference (NMW).
I propose that NHS should increase pay scales in line with 7.46% increase for others.

attributes.action: Get Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy on the NHS for Fibromyalgia sufferers.
attributes.background:
Fibromyalgia, is a condition that causes widespread pain all over the body.
There are many other symptoms that can affect a person with Fibromyalgia: fatigue, muscle stiffness, difficulty sleeping, problems with mental processes (known as "fibro-fog"), depression, headaches and many more
attributes.additional_details:
There are few available treatments that actually help people with Fibromyalgia.  Side effects from tablets can make it difficult for people to work and can cause additional issues. 
Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy (HBOT) really helps those with Fibromyalgia and allows a person to live a relatively normal life. It's simply a treatment of breathing pure oxygen under a pressurised condition at a diving depth that works for the individual. 
HBOT should be available on the NHS for Fibromyalgia sufferers.

attributes.action: Review the Armed Forces 1℅ paycap.
attributes.background: The Armed Forces have been on a 1℅ payrise for the last few years. Although the Government made around 20,000 servicemen redundant they task the Forces more frequently to backfill they're short falls (floods, Olympics etc) while they enjoyed a 11℅ pay rise last year and a 1.4℅ rise this year.
attributes.additional_details: A 1℅ pay increase does not reflect the cost of living. The cheapest food available to a single soldier is rising by 17℅ alone with accommodation also increasing. The extra duties placed on the Armed Forces (floods, Olympics, fuel strikes, fire strikes, prison strikes etc) deserve more than the 1℅ forced upon us when we are available 24/7. Compare this to MP's pay rises against the amount of time they spend actually working it is unfair and morally wrong.

attributes.action: Crack down on Puppy Farming/BY breeding with stricter breeding licence criteria.
attributes.background: The current criteria/eligibility and fees to obtain a dog breeding licence is making it open to everybody, we are over run with dogs and puppies in this country. Breeding is an easy option to make big money quick. We need to clamp down and start putting the welfare of the animals first.
attributes.additional_details:
Just check out sites such as gumtree, preloved, pets4homes, even Facebook....the number of adverts are in the 1000's, rescue centres are bursting at the seams - yet licences continue to be issued allowing further breeding. The welfare of the poor dogs being bred needs questioning as the needs of the dogs isn't always first priority.
This is how easy it is to get a license and the fee for a licence varies depending where you live.
https://www.gov.uk/dog-breeding-licence-england-scotland-wales

attributes.action: Search all Islamic buildings for weapons and extremist literature and items
attributes.background: As large numbers of weapons are being found in mosque's in Europe searches should be carried out in Britain to keep us safe from weapons and Islamic extremists

attributes.action: Reduce Wait for Appointments at Gender Identity Clinics for Transgender People
attributes.background: The current wait time for Transgender people for appointments and treatment at Gender Identity Clinics is regularly over 18 months. This has a negative effect on mental health; around 48% of the Trans Population have attempted suicide . Sign this petition to support a reduction in waiting times.
attributes.additional_details: Of the 7 UK GIC's, only 2 have waiting times below 1.5 years (http://uktrans.info/attachments/article/341/patientpopulation-apr15.pdf). The legal requirement is 18 weeks from referral. Once seen initially it can take months or even years to start treatment. There's often no contact from GIC's during this wait. This is unacceptable due to the effect on mental health and the suicide risk. Regular contact must be had to reassure people they are still in the system, and the wait MUST be reduced.

attributes.action: Allow EU citizens to remain in the UK after exit from the EU with same rights
attributes.background: EU citizens who study or work and pay taxes in the UK are a fundamental part of society. The UK would not be able to function without the taxes paid in by the EU immigrants. Their rights should also not be decreased if they've been paying in for years.

attributes.action: Enact a law making deception and lying by politicians a criminal offence.
attributes.background:
Politicians hold a priviliged position that has the potential to create damage to the welfare of the country and its populace when personal or party agendas take precedence.
Using deceit, lies or misdirection to pass legislation or support a position is unacceptable and must stop.
attributes.additional_details:
No action is ever taken against politicians whose actions while in government damages the country physically, socially or financially.
Basically politicians make it up as they go along, experimenting with aspects they dont grasp or have a personal axe to grind in doing so, example, Tony Blair and the unwritten mass immigration policy, David Camerons Lisbon Treaty referendum promise.
Politicians need to be financially and personally accountable to the public, we need a law to hold them to.

attributes.action: Vote on an early General Election before sending Article 50
attributes.background: The public have voted to leave the EU but with little indication of how negotiations will be approached. An election would allow the various Parties to set out their priorities (e.g. Market Access v's Restricted Movement) for negotiating our future EU relationship and let the people choose.

attributes.action: Free IVF treatment for women with diagnosed fertility problems.
attributes.background: Around 1 in 6 couples can have difficulty conceiving. Having a diagnosis of endometriosis from the age of 22 and trying to conceive for 5 years, IVF treatment on the NHS was refused due to my partner already having a child from a previous relationship.
attributes.additional_details: The National Institute for Health and Care Excellence (NICE) recommends that women aged 23 to 39 with fertility problems should be entitled to three cycles of IVF but those who have a partner with a child have to pay up to £6,500 per cycle which is unfair to women who are child-less.

attributes.action: Create an independent authority to fact-check political campaign materials.
attributes.background: There is a clear indication that misinformation was spread throughout both EU Referendum campaigns. We the undersigned, urge the government to create an independent authority to fact-check and monitor the legal standard of information for all official political campaign materials in future votes.
attributes.additional_details: In 1998, the Neill Committee recommended political parties should establish a code of best practice in partnership with the advertising industry. In 2003, the Electoral Commission concluded the Advertising Standards Authority should not be responsible for regulating election advertising, but the Commission did not establish a separate Code. This remains the case today. (ASA Political Advertising 21 July 2014).

attributes.action: The government and DWP  to recognize cardiac conditions are disability's
attributes.background: I am calling on the Government to recognise heart failure and other cardiac conditions as disabilities, for the purposes of working out who is entitled to disability benefits, for to long heart conditions and the disability's that they cause have been ignored in the entitlement for certain benefits
attributes.additional_details: I am 53 years old at present I had a myocardial infarction aged 30, double heart bypass aged 30 and a further bypass aged 33,  severe heart failure from the age of 30 , I have had umpteen cardiac arrests and have a implantable cardiovertor defibrillator resynchronization device , which was upgraded from an icd , because we look okay , DWP assessors think we are okay but can't see the damage inside ,  think it is time for the government to properly assess cardiac patients and their  disabilities

attributes.action: Hold referendum on whether country agrees with way government is managing NHS
attributes.background: Recent polls have shown that the people of the country disagree with the way the government is managing the NHS, the government claims it is carrying out what people want.  This is disputed. We call on parliament to debate possiblity of holding a referendum so the people can have their say.

attributes.action: Conduct an inquiry into the Police's actions at the Orgreave miners strike 1984
attributes.background: In addition to the Hillsborough Disaster, the public would like an inquiry into the same Police force that also policed the miners strike at Orgreave in 1984.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to include potassium content in food labelling in the UK.
attributes.background:
In England in 2008/09 there were 1,739,443 people aged 18 and over who were registered with CKD (stages 3-5).
According to NHS figures around 9% of the English adult population are estimated to have Chronic Kidney Disease between stage 3 and 5.
attributes.additional_details:
One of the problems with CKD is that the Kidneys are unable to regulate the level of Potassium in the blood.
High potassium can cause paralysis and heart problems, your heartbeat can become irregular and you can have heart failure. If left untreated, high potassium levels can even cause your heart to stop.
The easiest way to regulate potassium in the blood is through diet, but at the moment food in the UK does not contain information about Potassium levels so it is very difficult to do this.

attributes.action: Save the jobs of British Seafarers
attributes.background: Over the last couple of years, and especially during the current oil crisis, a large number of British seafarers have been made redundant by British based companies, and replaced with cheaper, foreign crew. How does this support the UK economy?
attributes.additional_details: Yet another example of companies making unethical choices at the expense of their employees. Many countries such as Australia and Canada insist that shipping companies based within their country employ mainly local crew. Surely the British Government can follow this example by protecting British Seafarers and the British Merchant Navy, which are considered to be some of the best mariners in the world. We cannot allow yet another proud British industry to be destroyed just to save £££s.

attributes.action: The Government should not proceed with plans to increase immigration court fees.
attributes.background: The Government has proposed a massive increase in the fees that immigrants and asylum seekers pay to have their immigration/asylum cases heard in court. This huge rise in fee (eg. from £140 to £800 for a hearing in court) will prevent individuals from being able to take their cases to court.
attributes.additional_details:
If the Home Office makes an incorrect decision on someone's case, this can usually be appealed in court. The fee increase will make people unable to challenge such decisions, leading to severe disruption in their personal/family lives.

Only rich people will be able to access courts, as the proposed amounts are impossible for most immigrants and asylum seekers to pay. This is unacceptable. 

http://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2016/apr/21/asylum-and-immigration-court-fees-set-to-rise-by-over-500

attributes.action: Increase the penalty for people who steal dogs.
attributes.background: The Theft Act of 1968 covers companion animals, and if your dog is stolen then you have the same legal rights of recourse as you would if anything else you owned was illegally taken.  However, our dogs are more than just posessions and should be afforded greater protection under the law.
attributes.additional_details:
Stolen pets are sold on the black market or used in illegal dog fights and it is believed by campaigners that police do not take the thefts seriously enough nor are the current penalties enough of a deterrent.

Dognapping, which is becoming increasingly violent, is worth at least £100,000 a year with more than 2,400 dogs stolen in 2014 & 2015.

To help protect our dog's from criminals I would like parliament to consider increasing the penalty for those convicted of stealing dogs.

attributes.action: Ensure those who live in supported housing are exempt from the LHA cap.
attributes.background: Plans to cap Local Housing Allowance (LHA) would mean a cut in the housing benefit for people living in specialist housing. This will affect thousands of the most vulnerable including older people, the disabled, domestic violence victims, young adults leaving care, homeless people & young families.
attributes.additional_details:
Some customers will be forced to find £584 extra a month or face homelessness. The cap will decimate the support housing sector, making schemes that provide additional support to those who really need it simply unviable, with the expectation that public services such as the NHS will pick up the pieces.

Read an open letter on #LHAcap by Bromford CEO Philippa Jones: http://www.bromford.co.uk/news-hub/blog/2016/january/mp-open-letter-local-housing-allowance-social-housing-impact-vulnerable-people

attributes.action: Stop the BBC Internet tax (proposed extension of the TV licence to iPlayer)
attributes.background: As the BBC knew that online content would be free when iPlayer was launched, there is no loophole. The proposed change is the first step towards an internet tax. It would give BBC 'officers' (i.e. civilians) authority to inspect home computer equipment. This breach of Civil Rights must be stopped.
attributes.additional_details: Also, the fee is excessive for iPlayer content only. Finally, iPlayer can be used for listening to BBC radio (legitimately licence-free). Why should the government further help a multi-billion pound global media company by extending outdated coercive measures when the BBC can simply cease to offer content on demand or password protect it? Too many undemocratic decisions like this have been taken without proper consultation. Petitioners urge Parliament to reconsider extending the TV poll tax.

attributes.action: I wish the Home Office to review the case of a Fijian soldier Semesa Maiyale.
attributes.background: Semesa Maiyale known as Sam joined the British army in 2003 and served both with the Kings Own Scottish Borders and then the Royal Regiment of Scotand serving nine years and completed tours of Iraq and was promised the right to remain in the Uk after his service ended.
attributes.additional_details: Sam was discharged in 2012, Sam has no right to work, cannot claim benefits or housing and is supported by his partner who as a nusery nurse is heavily in debt due to the pressure of providing for the both of them. Sam and his partner now live in homeless accommadation and sam rightly feels betrayed and let down.

attributes.action: House or subsidise rent for MOD Royal Gibraltar regiment serving soldiers.
attributes.background: Currently married soldiers serving in the Overseas Gibraltar regiment are not offered any form of SFA housing or help with rent relief. They are paid less than UK soldiers, live in a place with a much higher rate of living and has private rental prices of 1200-1500 for a 2 bed small flat.
attributes.additional_details: In 2011 the MOD gave back most of its housing stock to the Gibraltar Goverment in a land agreement. This caused an end to marriage accommodation for Serving MOD soldiers. Thus meaning soldiers were expected to pay £1200-1500 a month for a two bedroom on a soldiers wage. Soldiers cant afford this and are either having to rent illegally in Gibraltar, live in poverty, beg for postings to the uk which are limited, live in a different country than the one they are protecting or leave the regiment.

attributes.action: Reduce waiting times for driving test to 5 weeks
attributes.background: waiting times at present are over 16 weeks at some centres, this impacts greatly on people learning to drive. It add unnecessary costs to people learning to drive.For those who fail the first time around the wait for a second test means they have a less likely chance of passing second time around
attributes.additional_details: The DVSA say the waiting times are 9 to 10 weeks but according to the DVSA own test booking service the waiting times at some test centres is 16 weeks or more.

attributes.action: Ensure PDA is recognised, diagnosed & treated/educated nationally
attributes.background: Pathological Demand Avoidance Syndrome (PDA) was first described in the 1980s by Elizabeth Newson.  It is an Autism Spectrum Disorder.  However it has similarities to ADHD, ODD, ADD & Attachment Disorder and is often misdiagnosed.  This causes delays in providing appropriate education & support.
attributes.additional_details:
We need to ensure a national understanding amongst teaching social and health care professionals to ensure families already under considerable strain get access to the right support in a suitable time frame.  This is especially important in ensuring the right educational interventions to ensure children can continue to learn and integrate with society 

To find out more about PDA please look online at: 
http://www.thepdaresource.com 
http://www.pdasociety.org.uk 
http://www.autism.org.uk/pda

attributes.action: Make Homosexual Conversion/Reparative Therapy Illegal
attributes.background: Conversion or Reparative Therapy is the belief that through psychological intervention a person may be able to reject their own same sex attraction and become 'heterosexual'.This destructive and prejudiced rhetoric must be condemned as it's consequences for patients are detrimental to say the least.
attributes.additional_details: As found by the American Psychological Association, people that have gone through conversion therapy are 3 times more likely to use illegal drugs, be 8.9 times more likely to be subject to suicidal thoughts and face depression at 5.9 times the rate of their peers. As discovered by  Stonewall, out of 1300 mental health professionals, more than 200 had offered some form of this therapy, with 40% of treatments happening within the NHS. Some patients are even subjected to electroconvulsive therapy.

attributes.action: Make running over a cat and driving off without reporting it a criminal offense
attributes.background: Recently my cat was hit by a car luckily a very kind woman took her in wrapped her up put her in a towel & box and placed a rose in beside her its really affected us now its illegal to not report a dog, so why not a cat? There just as loved and apart of the family so let's make it illegal !
attributes.additional_details: All animals play a big part in your family so when it comes to running a cat over it should be treated the same way as if you had to run over a dog, your heart breaks just as much wither it be a cat or dog there should be no difference when it comes to justice for our furry friends, whoever ran my cat over must have been speeding due to the mess she was left it now think this could have been a child, your child , anyone with animals know how precious they are to you&your family please sign

attributes.action: Chicken Pox vaccination part of the NHS programme.
attributes.background: Chicken pox is considered a common childhood illness, Sadly it can cause unnecessary pain and suffering to many. And some have severe complications like my 2 year old son who has to be admitted to hospital after getting a severe infection in his chicken pox.
attributes.additional_details: Please sign this petition to help give parents and children the choice to have this vaccination on the NHS. My son is a healthy 2 year old and should not have had any complications. No other child should have to go through this. Make the change today for the health and future of our children.

attributes.action: Make Cannabis Oil (THC & CBD) Legal and Available on the NHS in the UK
attributes.background:
To help combat diseases such as cancer, MS, epilepsy and other debilitating and life threatening diseases.

Cannabis oil has been scientifically proven over and over again to help combat side effects and help battle the diseases stated above, and many more conditions.
attributes.additional_details:
We are asking for a MEDICAL marijuana program, people will get a prescription from a doctor who qualify as a patient. Cannabis oil has been vital to a lot of successful recovery stories and there have been many instances of medical 'miracles' achieved by patients using this plant. 

From combating the nausea from chemo to helping epilepsy patients have a fit free day the evidence is there and lots of it, who is anyone to deny these patients the treatment they want.
